title: Sculpterra 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Easygoing lemon pudding and peach scents show on the nose of this bottling, which is a blend from four vineyards. Ripe stone fruit flavors mark the palate, further enriched with tropical coconut touches.

title: Settesoli 2016 Mandrarossa Costa Dune Grillo (Sicilia)
description: This vibrant, slender white doles out grapefruit, pineapple and chopped herb aromas and flavors. An orange zest note closes the clean, crisp finish.

title: Suavia 2014 Massifitti Trebbiano (Veronese)
description: Made from 100% Trebbiano di Soave, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals white spring flower and white stone fruit whiffs. The palate is lean and dilute, offering hints of peach, bitter almond and citrus peel, alongside racy acidity.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Bo Rivage Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: Attractively onion-skin pink in color, this wine is lightly textured and delicate in flavor. It does have a dry peppery edge that brings out some structure. The wine's crisp fruit is restrained. Drink from late 2017.

title: Grizzly Peak 2013 Rogue Rouge Red (Rogue Valley)
description: A Bordeaux-style blend, it's half Merlot, the rest split between the Cabs. Suggestions of sweaty, funky aromas lead into a core of sweet candied fruit. It's a bit disjointed, fine for glugging, not for keeping.

title: La Bodega de Pinoso 2015 Cepa 50 Viñas Viejas Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Cherry and plum aromas are a touch grassy on this compact but extracted Monastrell. Cherry and black-plum flavors rumble away on a grabby rubbery tannic finish. This is a big loud warm-climate wine where elegance and finesse are not factors.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Simple aromas of Juicy Fruit gum lead to a fresh palate with light rubbery tannins. The flavor of pink grapefruit is singular, with mild bitterness setting in on a citric finish. This is lively but not an enamel peeler.

title: Trivento 2016 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of herbal black fruits and road tar are crisp and gritty. This is pulling and a bit raw in feel, while foxy herbal currant and black-plum flavors finish lively, with residual flavors of oak and clove.

title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée du Lion Rosé (Var)
description: This is a crisp fruity wine with delicious red currants. It has fine acidity as well, with a burst of freshness in the midst of the spicy, ripe wine. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Le Cloître Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a soft wine. Its rounded fruits and texture are gentle and smooth with a touch of caramel. The blend, dominated by Cinsault, gives a light spicy character as well as an attractive crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Collavini 2015 Fumat Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Lean and linear, this offers white spring flower and citrus impressions. It's simple but well made and refreshing.

title: Corte Adami 2015 Vigna della Corte  (Soave)
description: Subdued acacia flower, toasted nut and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the nose while the palate offers yellow apple skin flavors and a hint of citrus zest. Bitter almond marks the lean finish.

title: Corte Giara 2016  Soave
description: Here's a lively, informal white redolent of green apple, peach and citrus, with vibrant acidity. It's simple but well made, with a crisp, refreshing finish.

title: Cupcake 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Full bodied, dry and warmly fruity, this ripe-tasting and lush-textured wine has just enough tannin to add a little grip to each sip.

title: Cantine Ermes 2016 Vento di Mare Vino Biologico Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: This bright and simple wine offers citrus, Mediterranean brush and peach aromas and flavors. It closes on a saline touch.

title: Cantine Lenotti 2016  Soave Classico
description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine. They aromas carry over to the easygoing palate, with pineapple fruit and tangy acidity.

title: Castillo De Feliciana 2013 Reserve Red Wine Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are up front, with barrel notes of char, vanilla, coconut and baking spice followed by cigar box. The wood really shows through on the palate as well, with the tannins bringing a strong sense of astringency.

title: Domaine de Cause 2013 Tradition Malbec (Cahors)
description: In Cahors terms, a wine labeled Tradition is the entry-level wine of an estate, often unoaked as it is here. The wine successfully relies on the bold blackberry fruits and balanced acidity. With tannins forming a fine background, it is ready to drink.

title: Château Barbanau 2016 La Girafe Verte Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Organic grapes go into this light and fruity wine with its unexpected animal name. It is soft with bright red-berry fruits that are cut with acidity. The wine is dry with strong citrus flavors at the end. Drink now.

title: Château de Berne 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a rich wine, just beginning to mature. With berry fruits, some firm tannins and acidity, the wine is ripe, still showing some stalkiness and with a dry firm aftertaste. Drink starting from 2018.

title: Waterbrook 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of vanilla, coconut and wood spice lead to wood-filled flavors. The barrel notes are in complete control.

title: Aimé Roquesante 2016 Cuvée Selectionée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a smooth wine with rounded fruit and light acidity. It has refreshing red-berry fruits that give softness while also finishing with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Ampelos 2013 Syrache Ampelos Vineyard Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of 69% Syrah and 31% Grenache is smoky and oaky, with a strong charred meat flavor that obscures its lightly ripe strawberry fruit. The finish is simple and light.

title: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2016 Fontana  (Soave)
description: This opens with faint honeysuckle and white stone fruit aromas. The informal, lively palate offers green apple, peach and citrus hints, alongside bright acidity.

title: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Molino a Vento Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: Tropical fruit aromas meld with a whiff of Mediterranean herb. The bright, simple palate shows hints of banana and citrus, alongside zesty acidity.

title: Thomas Carteron 2016 Le Bonheur de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a really light wine with bright fruit and a crisp texture. It has a breezy feel—all crisp fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.

title: Estandon 2016 Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: From the small Coteaux Varois, a hilly region in central Provence, this is a crisp mineral-textured wine. It has lively acidity, citrus zest and a touch of red currants. It's a real food rosé. Ready now.

title: I Campi 2015 Campo Base  (Soave)
description: This wine's spring blossom, yellow apple and almond scents carry over to the light, rather diluted palate. Although simple, it's a great utility pour for large, informal gatherings or picnics.

title: Kirkland Signature 2013 Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of all five red Bordeaux varieties, with Cabernet Sauvignon making up the majority, this wine is simple in structure and softly layered with cherry, vanilla and cola waves.

title: Goose Bay 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (South Island)
description: A vibrant crimson in color, this offers more restrained aromas and flavors than expected. Cherries and citrus pith marry with notes of wet stone, finishing on a refreshing note despite the wine's ample weight.
